sourceDesc.p: MS (note written on inside of envelope), Huntington Library Dudley Costello Esquire. Date: Ben Jonson’s Every Man in His Humour was performed in 1845 by the Amateurs with Costello and Cattermole.

dateline.date: Saturday | 1st. Novr.Date at the bottom of the note.

body.p: Pray come to town,Costello was in Brighton (To Cattermole, 6 Nov 45; Pilgrim Letters George Cattermole (1800-68; Dictionary of National Biography), painter. Co-illustrator of The Old Curiosity Shop and Barnaby Rudge. See further Pilgrim Letters 1, p.277n., p. 428). if you can by any means, for this next rehearsal. I wouldn’t ask you under ordinary circumstances, but Cattermole the Painter4 plays WellbredThe part played by T. J. Thompson at the September performance; he had married Christiana Weller and gone abroad on his honeymoon. Cattermole was recruited for the performances on 15 Nov and 27 Dec. on a very short notice; and you are so exceedingly important to him in that quarrel Scene.Costello played Downright, half-brother to Wellbred: they quarrel in Act III, scene iv. Ever Yours
Rehearsal Calls.CD’s original intention presumably was to send just this sheet to Costello, before he underlined the situation’s urgency by the note inside the envelope.

–––––––––
St. James’s Theatre—Stage Door
Mr. Costello.
–––––––––

Wednesday 5th. Novr. ¼ before 7
Wednesday 12th. Novr.—Same hour
Attention and punctuality, indispensable, as it is very doubtful indeed, whether the Theatre can be spared on any other occasion
